info.title: api.audio
info.description: API.audio - the global backbone of audio production. Infrastructure for AI driven synthetic audio creation. Easily integrate audio into your product or allow end users to create high quality audio.

/script.description:
## Script (Content Management API)
This is an object representing your content in API.audio. Often for producing beautiful text-to-audio you'll need to write some text or import text from another system
You can also [retrieve all the Scripts](https://docs.api.audio/reference/listscripts) you've created.

Each script has a unique *scriptId* which you can reference. 

### Annotation

Script resource is driven by [Annotation system](https://docs.api.audio/docs/annotation), through which text is sorted into sections, assigned to sound segments and integrated with sound effects and custom media files.

### Script sections

Each script section can be spoken by a separate speaker, have its own Speech configuration or be forced into a given length in Mastering.

### SSML

We're working on unified SSML system compatible with all the voices in our library. Until then, please make sure that the tags used in your Script are supported by the original provider of the voice.

### Project-Module-Script structure

A problem that you may have is that you may want to store some structure of your projects. For example "where do I store all of my scripts"? Well you can store them in modules and store modules in projects. 

Scripts are nested in modules, modules are nested in projects. The combination of these names generates a scriptId, with which the Script is referenced in other parts of the API. 

### Custom scriptId

Another way is to specify your own scriptId - this way all these layers have the name of scriptId. 

###Script versioning

Each script can have its own versions, that can easily be switched in later Speech or Mastering process.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

post.description:
### Note: If referenced Script already exists, this method updates it.
## Annotation system in `scriptText`
### Personalisation parameters/audience
- Personalisation parameters can be used to dynamically replace content components within a script.
- E.g. `"Today is {{weekday|a good day}}!"`
### Sections
- A section is processed individually in later stages of Speech, and treated as a unit in Mastering process.
- E.g. `"<<sectionName::intro>>Hello!"`
### Sound Segments
- Nests the content in a segment of a sound template. See available sound templates at https://library.api.audio/sounds.
- E.g. `"<<soundSegment::intro>><<sectionName::intro>>Hello!"`
### Sound Effects
- Inserts sound effect belonging to the sound template
- E.g. `"<<soundEffect::effect2>>Hurry up, the time is ticking!"`

**Coming up!** Sound effects will soon be available globally, independent of the sound template applied.
### Media Files
- Insert a placeholder for a media file that is specified on Mastering stage. Media files are uploaded through /file/customaudio/uploadurl.
- E.g. `"Bruce Lee once said: <<media::bruce_lee_talking>>"`
### SSML
- Synthetic Speech Markup Language standard. Accepted tags vary across providers, so make sure to consult their documentation.
- E.g. `<break time = '2s'/>`

**Coming up!** We're working on a SSML standard that mitigates all the discrepancies between the providers.

scriptId.description: Reference string to the Script. If specified, project, module and script names are the same as the script ID. Otherwise, it is generated and provided in the response.

scriptText.example:
<<soundSegment::intro>>
<<sectionName::intro>>
This is the first section. Sound segment refers to the sound template that is applied in Mastering. I can use a parameter that I can specify later on the stage of Speech creation: today is {{weekday|a good day}}. If a weekday parameter is not specified, it will fallback to "a good day".
<<soundSegment::main>>
<<sectionName::main>>
This is the main part of the script. Let's use a custom media file <<media::myfile>>. I can insert here any of the files I have uploaded, by referencing "myfile" to the mediaId during Mastering process. 
<<soundSegment::outro>>
<<sectionName::outro>>
And this is the end with an effect <<soundEffect::effect1>>. The effect belongs to the applied sound template.

version.description: Default version is v0. You can create limitless versions of one scriptId, which is handy in cases of multilingual coverage, targeted content etc.

/speech.description:
##TTS service. 
Speech resource is responsible for creating TTS out of **Script** resource, or, in case of /speech/sync endpoint, direct TTS synthesis out of text.

Any voice available in the **Voice Library** can be used to synthesize speech per **Script** section.

If your **Script** contains text to be synthesised, it is necessary to synthesise it here before moving on to **Mastering**.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

post.description:
Good for extensive content. 
- Set `sync` field to false for asynchronous behaviour (no waiting for response, retrieve it later using GET method).

- Each Script section can have a separate configuration. 

- Script sections are synthesized in parallel, you may use it to your advantage to increase time performance.

- Script sections that contain a media or sound effect tags are split into multiple files, as the media are rendered in `/mastering`. Similarly, a Script section containing only media tags will not be rendered here.

- Currently only wav format is supported in the output.

requestBody.description: Defined configuration applies globally to all the Script sections. Use `sections` field to overwrite fields in sections.

scriptId.description: Reference to the Script that is to be synthesized, use `/script` to create and get it.

version.description: Specific version of the referenced Script.

voice.description: Either alias or original (provider's) ID. Available voices are listed at https://library.api.audio/

silencePadding.description: Amount of microseconds for silence padding. Half of the amount is inserted as silence at the beginning and at the end of each Speech file.

audience.description: Object defining the values for Script parameters. E.g. for Script parameters in `Hello {{username}}, how's your {{weekday}} going?` the object would be `{"username": "Michael", "weekday": "Sunday"}`.

sections.description: Separate configurations for Script section. E.g. to specify a separate voice and speed for Script section `intro` the object would be `{"main": {"voice": "Leah", "speed": 1.2}}`.

useDictionary.description: Whether to apply phoneme injections specified in Script.

useTextNormalizer.description: Applies text normalization, which can help resolve grammatical errors with TTS pronunciations, for example 11:12 Uhr -> 11 Uhr 12. Note - this only works for german voices at present.

200.description:
Requests to TTS models were succesfully sent and responses were gathered. Look into the results of each section to determine whether the synthesis itself was succesful.

Keys are Script section names. If a Script section was split, the name will have `_N` appended to it e.g. intro, intro_2, intro_3 ...

outro.message: AZURE voice model could not process the script : Invalid response received: code: 400, message: The 'mstts:express-as' start tag on line 1 position 165 does not match the end tag of 'voice'. Line 1, position 290.

message.description: Either `{provider}/{alias} : synthesis successful.` or an error message.

status_code.description: "201" means created, "422" means there was some issue that is described in the `message` field.

url.description: URL to download the synthesized file.

202.description: Synthesis is in progress on the server side. Returned when `sync` field is set to false, or when response wait is approaching 30 seconds.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

get.description:
The endpoint holds on with the response when there is a server-side synthesis in progress for given `scriptId`. Just as POST method, it returns `202` when approaching 30 seconds of response wait.

`scriptId` and `requestId` are interchangeable.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Reference to the Script that is to be retrieved. Use /script to create and get it.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Specific version of the Script to be retrieved.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Reference to the particular Speech request to be retrieved.

parameters.name: section
parameters.description: Section name of the specific section to be retrieved.

parameters.name: scriptParameters
parameters.description: Reference to specified audience in POST request. E.g. for audience `{"username": "Michael", "weekday": "Sunday"}` the parameters would be `username=Michael&weekday=Sunday` (not case-sensitive).

200.description: Returned URLs for all sections. As in POST, keys are Script section names, but the value is just the URL string.

<sectionName>.description: URL to download the synthesized file.

202.description: Synthesis is in progress on the server side. Returned when response wait is approaching 30 seconds.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

422.description: At least one of the Script sections encountered a problem during synthesis. Keys are Script section names.

message.description: Either `{provider}/{alias} : synthesis successful.` or an error message.

post.description:
Good for time-critical applications. **Maximum runtime is 30 seconds**.
### Caching
TTS responses are globally cached to improve performance. You can set `Cache-Control` to `no-cache` to skip the cache.
Following parameters are hashed as the cache key:
  - text
  - voice
  - speed
  - metadata
  - effect
  - bitrate
  - sampling_rate
  - output specified by the `Accept` header

Cache is missed when any of these parameters change.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the output audio.

requestBody.description:
Fields `text` and `ssml` are interchangeable.
### SSML
  When using `ssml` field, expected SSML format varies depending on provider of the voice. 

  If in doubt, consult provider's SSML documentation. Any kind of error will be forwarded back to you.
### Limits
  Maximum character lengths:
  - `text` field: 800 characters
  - `ssml` field: 1000 characters

ssml.description: Text in SSML format to synthesize. Maximum 1000 characters. Expected SSML format varies depending on provider of the voice.

voice.description: Either alias or original (provider's) ID. Available voices are listed at https://library.api.audio/

metadata.description: Return JSON with base64 encoded audio and visemes, if available.

sampling_rate.description: Sampling rate of the output. Applicable to wave format.

bitrate.description: Bitrate of the output. Applicable to mp3 format.

200.description: Successful synthesis. Type of returned content is specified by `Accept` header in the request and `metadata` field.

sampling_rate.description: Sampling rate of the returned file.

items.description: This is an object schema for Messner visemes. Voices from resemble.ai return a different response. We're working on unifying metadata alltogether.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

422.description: Unprocessable entity. Error messages explain the problem.

/mastering.description: ##Mastering service combines Speech, Media and Sound templates into a high-quality audio track.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

post.description: Keep in mind that in order to successfuly create a mastered file for a Script, Speech files must be generated for that Script beforehand, given it contains any content for synthesis.

scriptId.description: Reference to the Script to master.

audience.description: Object referencing the audience used in Speech production.

soundTemplate.description: Reference to the sound template to be applied. Available sound templates: https://library.api.audio/sounds

masteringPreset.description: The mastering preset to use, this enables features such as sidechain compression 'i.e. ducking'. GET /mastering-presets to see available presets.

public.description: Whether the mastered file should be accessible by anyone in the internet. Use it at your own risk.

vast.description: Create a VAST file of your mastered file. The vast flag only works if public is True.

endFormat.description: Format of the output file. Very low - very high refers to the quality of mp3 (bitrate).

forceLength.description: Force the total length of the mastered file to the amount of seconds.

sectionProperties.description: Force length of particular Script sections.

endAt.description: Timemark in seconds at which the section is supposed to end.

justify.description:
Flex-start (default): any gap between speech/effect/media ending and the next section starting is placed at the end of the current section. Speech will start at the very beginning together with the sound.
                                  
Centre: Gaps are placed evenly at the start and end of the current section. Speech will float in the middle of the section.

Flex-end: The gap is placed at the start of the current section. Speech is pushed to the end of the section, with sound starting at the beginning.

Exceeding content is faded out.

matchVoice.description: Levels the volume of synthetic speech with the volume of media files.

mediaVolumeTrim.description: Trim the volume of the media files used (in dB). This attribute has a valid range of -12 to 12 dB.

connectors.description: List of dicts specifying configuration for particular 3rd party connection. For guidelines in context of supported 3rd party application, see [connectors documentation](https://docs.api.audio/docs/what-are-connectors).

share.description: If you would like to have a sharable link created with your audio file, use this flag. If you put `share: True` the response will have `shareUrl` parameter returned. (Note: If you put this flag, your private files will be converted to public files.)

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

parameters.name: scriptId
parameters.description: Reference to the Script from which the file was produced.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Version of the Script.

parameters.name: scriptParameters
parameters.description: Reference to specified audience in POST /speech. E.g. for audience `{"username": "Michael", "weekday": "Sunday"}` the parameters would be `username=Michael&weekday=Sunday` (not case-sensitive).

parameters.name: public
parameters.description: Whether the produced file is public.

parameters.name: vast
parameters.description: Whether to retrieve the VAST file.

parameters.name: endFormat
parameters.description: The format in which the file was produced.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.
Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.
Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

get.description: Multiple values can be specified in tags and collections through comma separation e.g. `?tags=intense,minimal`

isElastic.description: An elastic template seemlessly shrinks and grows to any length.

sample.description: Audio sample of the Sound Template.

contents.description: Segments and sound effects available in the Sound Template.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

get.summary: List all parameters in available templates.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

get.summary: Upload a file to use in <<media::alias>> Script annotation.
get.description:
This endpoint returns `mediaId` that is **the reference to the file** and the upload URL. In order to upload your file, make a PUT request to the returned URL, with your file as payload. 

Think of the alias part of <<media::alias>> annotation as the reference to the **placeholder** in the Script. You link this placeholder to the actual file by using `mediaFiles` field in POST /mastering request, e.g. `mediaFiles={"alias": "f22e7250"}`

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file. Not a reference!

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags to link to the file, separated by comma, e.g. "recording,happy"

fileUploadUrl.description: Make a PUT request to this URL with your file in the payload in order to upload it.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: List only files that have given tag.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

/diction.description: Pronunciation dictionaries contain IPA records of words to ensure correct pronunciation independently of TTS' language.

/orchestrator.description: ##Orchestrator service brings all the fundamental API services (Script, Speech, Mastering) down to one request.

scriptText.description: Script text to synthesise. This is passed to Script service, so Script annotations are supported.

/ulvc2/users.description: ## CRUD users resource. List, create, update and delete users. Files and trained models must belong to a user.

selectedVerticals.description: Verticals that are selected for users to record. Selected vertical must be included in availableVerticals.

/ulvc2/verticals.description:
CRUD verticals resource. Create, read, update and delete verticals and their content (utterances). 
Verticals belong to organisation. Public verticals available to everybody start with `public_aflr`.
These are not available straight away, first they need to be added to a users' `availableVerticals` field.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

id.description: Unique identifier, no longer than 100 characters.

languageCode.description: Two character language code compliant with ISO standard, e.g. "en" for English.

id.description: Unique identifier of the utterance. No more than 100 characters.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: Number of utterances to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Use together with `quantity` to paginate through utterances. If quantity is 10 in one request, the offset should be 10 in the next one.

languageCode.description: Two character language code compliant with ISO standard, e.g. "en" for English.

utterances.description: Shown only when `showUtterances` is set to true.

/ulvc2/models.description: ## CRUD models resource. List, retrieve and delete models. Models are linked to users.

get.summary: Lists all models belonging to the organisation.

id.description: The ID of the model. Use this ID to refere to the model in other parts of apiaudio.

userId.description: Owner of the audio files used for training.

gender.description: Inherited from user of which data was used for training.

languageCode.description: ISO compliant language code, e.g. `en-US`. Inherited from used verticals.

verticalsUsed.description: IDs of verticals used for training data.

trainingDataDuration.description: Amount of seconds of all the training data.

status.description:
- "starting": Training initiated
- "training": Training in progress
- "deploying": Model is being deployed to apiaudio library
- "ready": Model is ready to use in Speech module of apiaudio
- "failed": Model training has failed. This normally shouldn't happen and indicates server-side error.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.
Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

get.summary: Returns utterances to be recorded. Looks at `selectedVerticals` of the user and subtracts already recorded utterances.

parameters.name: quantity
parameters.description: The amount of utterances to return per vertical.

parameters.name: verticalId
parameters.description: Specific vertical to be returned.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

get.summary: Get QA feedback for recorded files.

parameters.name: utteranceId
parameters.description: Return specified utterance evaluation

parameters.name: maxNumItems
parameters.description: Return specified number of item evaluations if utteranceId not specified

parameters.name: deltaHours
parameters.description: Return item evaluations since given number of hours if verticalId and utteranceId not specified.

parameters.name: extendedFeedback
parameters.description: Return expanded evaluations apart from summarised results.

assess_background_noise_passed.description: Number of items that passed the background noise evaluation. Lufs average of the background noise extracted after normalization needs to be under -57 dBs.

assess_clipping_passed.description: Number of items that passed the clipping evaluation.

assess_reverb_passed.description: Number of items that passed the reverberation evaluation.

assess_text_coverage_passed.description: Number of items that passed the text coverage evaluation. Rating of the uttered words against the contents of the corresponding script.

missed_words.description: If text coverage failed, returns a list of missing words.

missed_word_indices.description: If text coverage failed, returns a list of indices of the missing words.

assess_interrupted_passed.description: Number of items that passed the interruptions evaluation. Interrupted is linked to the text coverage assessment and specifically flags premature stopped recordings by focusing on trailing missing words.

assess_too_loud_passed.description: Number of items that passed the maximum loudness limit evaluation. Lufs average loudness of the recording needs to be under -12 dBs.

assess_too_quiet_passed.description: Number of items that passed the minimum loudness limit evaluation. Lufs average loudness of the recording needs to be above -29 dBs.

audio_evaluation_passed.description: Number of items that passed all the audio evaluation checks.

valid_audio.description: Number of items that conform to valid audio checks. Valid audio files need to be .wav recordings of a minimum sample rate of 16 kHz, no longer than 15 seconds and must contain at least one intelligible word.

extendedFeedback.description: Individual detailed evaluation for each returned item.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

post.summary: Initiate training of a TTS model for given user. There must be a minimum of 100 files recorded that've passed the QA by the specified user.

name.description: Custom name for the model. Purely descriptive.

verticalsToUse.description: IDs of verticals to use as training data. If not specified, all available files will be used.

400.description: Bad request. Error messages explain the problem.

message.example: Access denied. No authentication method can be found.
